alert.note: Alert for Sheridan Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 8:12PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Sheridan County through 900 PM MDT... At 811 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 25 miles east of Sheridan, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. Very heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Sheridan County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle over flooded roadways.
